'''Travis Michael Kelce''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|k|ɛ|l|s|i|audio=En-us-Kelce.ogg}} {{respell|KEL|see}};{{efn|Kelce has stated that he pronounces his last name {{IPAc-en|ˈ|k|ɛ|l|s|i}} {{respell|KEL|see}}, as that is how his father pronounces it, although the rest of his father's side of the family pronounces it {{IPAc-en|k|ɛ|l|s}} {{respell|KELSS}}.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Rivera |first=Joe |date=July 16, 2021 |title=Travis Kelce continues to confuse everyone when it comes to his name pronunciation |url=https://www.sportingnews.com/us/nfl/news/travis-kelce-confuses-every-name-pronunciation/1b7nkt8rgopz018otwxv0o3ony |access-date=July 28, 2021 |website=Sporting News |quote=I say /ˈkɛlsi/ because that's what my father says. |archive-date=January 28, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220128145733/https://www.sportingnews.com/us/nfl/news/travis-kelce-confuses-every-name-pronunciation/1b7nkt8rgopz018otwxv0o3ony |url-status=live }}</ref> Kelce's brother, Jason, later elaborated that their father "at some point ... got tired of correcting everyone calling him 'Kell-see.' ... And now I think we're both at the point where we're riding with Ed 'Kell-see{{'"}}.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Zangaro |first=Dave |date=July 15, 2021 |title=Jason Kelce helps solve recent mystery about pronunciation of last name |url=https://www.nbcsports.com/philadelphia/eagles/eagles-jason-kelce-clears-how-pronounce-his-last-name |access-date=February 3, 2022 |publisher=NBC Sports |archive-date=May 12, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220512151144/https://www.nbcsports.com/philadelphia/eagles/eagles-jason-kelce-clears-how-pronounce-his-last-name |url-status=live }}</ref>}} born October 5, 1989) is an American [[Professional gridiron football|professional football]] [[tight end]] for the [[Kansas City Chiefs]] of the [[National Football League]] (NFL). He was selected by the Chiefs in the third round of the [[2013 NFL draft]] and later won Super Bowls [[Super Bowl LIV|LIV]], [[Super Bowl LVII|LVII]], and [[Super Bowl LVIII|LVIII]] with the team. He played [[college football]] for the [[University of Cincinnati]] [[Cincinnati Bearcats football|Bearcats football]] program.

Considered one of the greatest tight ends of all time,<ref>{{Cite web |date=October 11, 2022 |title=Where Travis Kelce stands among the greatest tight ends of all time |url=https://www.foxsports.com/stories/nfl/where-travis-kelce-stands-among-the-greatest-tight-ends-of-all-time |access-date=January 8, 2023 |website=FOX Sports |archive-date=January 8, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230108062043/https://www.foxsports.com/stories/nfl/where-travis-kelce-stands-among-the-greatest-tight-ends-of-all-time |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Kerr |first=Jeff |date=December 3, 2022 |title=Is Travis Kelce the best TE of all time? Where Chiefs star compares to all-time greats at the position |url=https://www.cbssports.com/nfl/news/is-travis-kelce-the-best-te-of-all-time-where-chiefs-star-compares-to-all-time-greats-at-the-position/ |access-date=January 8, 2023 |work=CBS Sports |archive-date=January 8, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230108062043/https://www.cbssports.com/nfl/news/is-travis-kelce-the-best-te-of-all-time-where-chiefs-star-compares-to-all-time-greats-at-the-position/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Kelce is a nine-time [[Pro Bowl]]er and a seven-time [[All-Pro]], with four first-team and three second-team selections. He holds the [[List of NFL individual records|NFL records]] for most consecutive and most overall seasons with 1,000 [[Reception (gridiron football)|receiving]] yards by a tight end: seven.<ref name="10,000 yards"/> He holds the record for most receiving yards by a tight end in a single season with 1,416 in 2020, despite playing in only 15 games.<ref name="Reception record"/><ref name="Receptions"/> 

During the 2022 season, Kelce became the fifth NFL tight end to reach 10,000 career receiving yards and reached the milestone faster than any tight end in NFL history.<ref name="10,000 yards" /> Kelce was named to the [[National Football League 2010s All-Decade Team|NFL 2010s All-Decade Team]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Scott |first=J.P. |date=June 21, 2022 |title=25 Greatest Tight Ends in NFL History |url=https://athlonsports.com/nfl/25-greatest-tight-ends-nfl-history |access-date=August 9, 2022 |website=Athlon Sports |archive-date=August 9, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220809220024/https://athlonsports.com/nfl/25-greatest-tight-ends-nfl-history |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Fragoza |first=James |date=October 24, 2021 |title=13 greatest tight ends of all time from Tony Gonzalez to Jackie Smith |url=https://www.profootballnetwork.com/ranking-top-tight-ends-in-nfl-history/ |access-date=August 9, 2022 |website=Pro Football Network |archive-date=August 9, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220809220404/https://www.profootballnetwork.com/ranking-top-tight-ends-in-nfl-history/ |url-status=live }}</ref> During the 2023 season, he surpassed [[Jerry Rice]] in career playoff receptions en route to [[Super Bowl LVIII]], his fourth Super Bowl appearance in five seasons.

Outside of football, Kelce has appeared on [[Reality television|reality]] and [[scripted television]], including being the namesake of the [[dating show]] ''Catching Kelce'' on [[E!]], hosting the March 5, 2023, episode of ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'', and in [[advertisements]]. He co-hosts the [[podcast]] ''[[New Heights]]'' with his brother [[Jason Kelce|Jason]], covering topics from football to popular culture. The show was ranked as the 8th most popular show in the US on [[Apple Podcasts]] in 2024.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Apple shares the most popular podcasts of 2024 |url=https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2024/11/apple-shares-the-most-popular-podcasts-of-2024/ |access-date=December 13, 2024 |website=Apple Newsroom |language=en-US}}</ref>

Kelce's relationship with singer-songwriter [[Taylor Swift]] has drawn massive media coverage and stimulated viewership and revenue for his team and its league.

==Early life==
Kelce was born on October 5, 1989, in [[Westlake, Ohio]]. His father, Ed Kelce, is a former sales representative in the steel industry, and his mother, [[Donna Kelce|Donna]], is a former bank executive. Kelce's older brother [[Jason Kelce|Jason]] played center for the [[Philadelphia Eagles]] for 13 seasons.<ref>{{Cite web |last=McManus |first=Tim |date=February 22, 2020 |title=Sibling fights to Super Bowls: Kelce boys have always been life of party |url=https://www.espn.com/blog/philadelphia-eagles/post/_/id/29128/sibling-fights-to-super-bowls-kelce-boys-have-always-been-life-of-party |access-date=September 22, 2023 |publisher=ESPN |archive-date=August 9, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220809224512/https://www.espn.com/blog/philadelphia-eagles/post/_/id/29128/sibling-fights-to-super-bowls-kelce-boys-have-always-been-life-of-party |url-status=live }}</ref>

Kelce attended [[Cleveland Heights High School]] in his hometown of [[Cleveland Heights, Ohio]], where he played [[high school football|football]], [[high school basketball|basketball]], and [[baseball]].<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Greene |first=Dan |date=October 18, 2017 |title=That's So Travis: Chiefs' Star TE Not Afraid To Be Himself |url=https://www.si.com/nfl/2017/10/18/travis-kelce-kansas-city-chiefs |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180123075222/https://www.si.com/nfl/2017/10/18/travis-kelce-kansas-city-chiefs |archive-date=January 23, 2018 |access-date=January 24, 2018 |magazine=Sports Illustrated}}</ref> He was a three-year letter winner as [[quarterback]] for the Tigers. As a senior in 2007, he ran for 1,016 yards and 10 touchdowns and threw for 1,523 yards, 21 touchdowns, and eight interceptions. His 2,539 yards of total offense garnered him All-Lake Erie League honors.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Setter |first=Aidan |date=September 22, 2015 |title=Kansas City Chiefs: Travis Kelce In The Spotlight |url=https://kckingdom.com/2015/09/22/kansas-city-chiefs-travis-kelce-spotlight/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190223020431/https://kckingdom.com/2015/09/22/kansas-city-chiefs-travis-kelce-spotlight/ |archive-date=February 23, 2019 |access-date=February 22, 2019 |website=KC Kingdom}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Mosby |first=Chris |date=October 3, 2017 |title=CHUH Alum, NFL Star Travis Kelce Shouts Out Alma Mater |url=https://patch.com/ohio/clevelandheights/chuh-alum-nfl-star-travis-kelce-shouts-out-alma-mater |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180402035532/https://patch.com/ohio/clevelandheights/chuh-alum-nfl-star-travis-kelce-shouts-out-alma-mater |archive-date=April 2, 2018 |access-date=April 1, 2018 |website=Cleveland Heights, OH Patch}}</ref>

==College career==
Considered a two-star recruit by [[Rivals.com]], Kelce accepted a scholarship offer from the [[University of Cincinnati]] over offers from [[University of Akron|Akron]], [[Eastern Michigan University|Eastern Michigan]], and [[Miami University|Miami (OH)]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Travis Kelce |url=https://n.rivals.com/content/prospects/2008/travis-kelce-12204 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171010210434/https://n.rivals.com/content/prospects/2008/travis-kelce-12204 |archive-date=October 10, 2017 |access-date=October 10, 2017 |website=n.rivals.com}}</ref> He joined his brother, Jason Kelce, who was the starting left guard for the [[Cincinnati Bearcats football|Bearcats]]. After [[Redshirt (college sports)|redshirting]] in 2008, he appeared in 11 games in 2009, playing at tight end and quarterback out of the [[Wildcat formation]]. He tallied eight rushes for 47 yards and two touchdowns and had one reception for three yards.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Travis Kelce 2009 Game Log |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/players/travis-kelce-1/gamelog/2009/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180125134609/https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/players/travis-kelce-1/gamelog/2009/ |archive-date=January 25, 2018 |access-date=January 24, 2018 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com}}</ref> He was suspended for the 2010 season after testing positive for marijuana, a violation of team rules.<ref>{{Cite web |date=December 24, 2019 |title=Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce continues to grow and evolve |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/nfl/2019/12/24/chiefs-tight-end-travis-kelce-continues-to-grow-and-evolve/40885457/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200524060812/https://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/nfl/2019/12/24/chiefs-tight-end-travis-kelce-continues-to-grow-and-evolve/40885457/ |archive-date=May 24, 2020 |access-date=November 4, 2020 |newspaper=USA Today |agency=[[Associated Press]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Pawlowski |first=Justin |date=February 23, 2013 |title=NFL Draft: TE Travis Kelce's Character Concerns |url=http://tampa.cbslocal.com/2013/02/23/nfl-draft-te-travis-kelces-character-concerns/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150926003146/http://tampa.cbslocal.com/2013/02/23/nfl-draft-te-travis-kelces-character-concerns/ |archive-date=September 26, 2015 |access-date=September 9, 2015 |publisher=CBS Tampa Bay}}</ref> Returning for the 2011 season, he played tight end, recording 13 catches totaling 150 yards and two touchdowns.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Travis Kelce 2011 Game Log |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/players/travis-kelce-1/gamelog/2011 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170724085417/https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/players/travis-kelce-1/gamelog/2011/ |archive-date=July 24, 2017 |access-date=January 24, 2018 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com}}</ref> In 2012, his last collegiate season, he set personal season highs in receptions (45), receiving yards (722), yards per receptions (16.0), and receiving touchdowns (8). Kelce earned first-team all-conference honors<ref>{{Cite web |title=Travis Kelce 2012 Game Log |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/players/travis-kelce-1/gamelog/2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180125074626/https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/players/travis-kelce-1/gamelog/2012 |archive-date=January 25, 2018 |access-date=January 24, 2018 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com}}</ref> and in March 2013,  was named the College Football Performance Awards Tight End of the Year.<ref>{{Cite web |title=2012 CFPA TIGHT END TROPHY |url=http://collegefootballperformance.com/offensive-awards/tight-end/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150813170149/http://collegefootballperformance.com/offensive-awards/tight-end/ |archive-date=August 13, 2015 |access-date=September 9, 2015 |website=College Football Performance Awards}}</ref> Kelce graduated in 2022 with a Bachelor of Interdisciplinary Studies degree,<ref>{{cite web |last1=Kern |first1=Jac |title=Everything you need to know about UC alum Travis Kelce |url=https://www.uc.edu/news/articles/2023/09/who-is-travis-kelce.html |website=UC News |language=en-us |date=September 29, 2023 |access-date=November 13, 2023 |archive-date=November 13, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231113105636/https://www.uc.edu/news/articles/2023/09/who-is-travis-kelce.html |url-status=live }}</ref> he received his diploma during an April 2024 podcast event at the Fifth Third Arena with his brother Jason.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Kaplan |first=Anna |date=April 12, 2024 |title=Travis Kelce finally graduates from college with brother Jason ===2013 season===
{{See also|2013 Kansas City Chiefs season}}
Kelce was selected by the [[Kansas City Chiefs]] in the third round (63rd pick overall) of the [[2013 NFL draft]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Teicher |first=Adam |date=April 26, 2013 |title=Chiefs draft TE Kelce, RB Davis in NFL Draft's third round |url=http://www.kansascity.com/2013/04/26/4204793/chiefs-draft-tight-end-travis.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130430205451/http://www.kansascity.com/2013/04/26/4204793/chiefs-draft-tight-end-travis.html |archive-date=April 30, 2013 |access-date=September 9, 2015 |website=Kansas City Star}}</ref> The Chiefs had hired [[Andy Reid]] as their new head coach during the off-season. Reid was familiar with Kelce, having drafted and coached his brother, Jason Kelce, in 2011 during his time as the head coach of the Eagles.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Kansas City Chiefs Coaches |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/teams/kan/coaches.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180402105712/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/teams/kan/coaches.htm |archive-date=April 2, 2018 |access-date=April 1, 2018 |publisher=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Thorman |first=Joel |date=April 27, 2013 |title=Chief's draft picks 2013:5 things you need to know about Travis Kelce |url=http://www.arrowheadpride.com/platform/amp/2013/4/27/4273998/chiefs-draft-picks-2013-travis-kelce |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170202045716/http://www.arrowheadpride.com/platform/amp/2013/4/27/4273998/chiefs-draft-picks-2013-travis-kelce |archive-date=February 2, 2017 |access-date=November 6, 2016 |website=arrowheadpride.com}}</ref> On June 6, 2013, the Chiefs signed Kelce to a four-year, $3.12 million rookie contract that also included a signing bonus of $703,304.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Sportrac.com: Travis Kelce contracts |url=http://www.spotrac.com/nfl/kansas-city-chiefs/travis-kelce-12344/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161030075008/http://www.spotrac.com/nfl/kansas-city-chiefs/travis-kelce-12344/ |archive-date=October 30, 2016 |access-date=October 29, 2016 |website=sportrac.com}}</ref>

Kelce injured his knee in the preseason. The injury was later diagnosed as a bone bruise. After being limited the first two weeks of the season due to the injury and being inactive the next three games, Kelce was placed on injured reserve on October 12, 2013, after having a microfracture surgery performed on his knee.<ref>{{Cite web |date=October 12, 2013 |title=Chiefs place tight end Travis Kelce on injured reserve |url=https://www.nbcsports.com/nfl/profootballtalk/rumor-mill/news/chiefs-place-tight-end-travis-kelce-on-injured-reserve |access-date=October 24, 2023 |publisher=NBC Sports |archive-date=November 2, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231102025401/https://www.nbcsports.com/nfl/profootballtalk/rumor-mill/news/chiefs-place-tight-end-travis-kelce-on-injured-reserve |url-status=live }}</ref> He only played one snap, on special teams in the Chiefs' Week 2 game against the [[Dallas Cowboys]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Dallas Cowboys at Kansas City Chiefs – September 15th, 2013 Box Score |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201309150kan.htm |access-date=September 2, 2022 |publisher=Pro-Football-Reference.com |archive-date=October 5, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201005175911/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201309150kan.htm |url-status=live }}</ref>

===2014 season===
[[File:Travis Kelce.JPG|thumb|upright=1|Kelce in 2014]]
{{See also|2014 Kansas City Chiefs season}}
During Week 3 against the [[Miami Dolphins]], Kelce recorded his first NFL touchdown on a 20-yard reception from quarterback [[Alex Smith]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Kansas City Chiefs at Miami Dolphins – September 21st, 2014 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201409210mia.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190801195125/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201409210mia.htm |archive-date=August 1, 2019 |access-date=January 24, 2018 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]]}}</ref> On November 30, he was fined $11,025 for "unsportsmanlike conduct" during a 29–16 loss to the [[Denver Broncos]]. Kelce made an inappropriate hand gesture and motion at Broncos linebacker [[Von Miller]]. Chiefs' head coach Andy Reid later called this "immature".<ref>{{Cite news |last=Teicher |first=Adam |date=December 6, 2014 |title=Travis Kelce fined $11K for gesture |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/story/_/id/11984128/travic-kelce-kansas-city-chiefs-fined-11025-gesture |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151204141545/http://espn.go.com/nfl/story/_/id/11984128/travic-kelce-kansas-city-chiefs-fined-11025-gesture |archive-date=December 4, 2015 |access-date=September 9, 2015 |agency=ESPN}}</ref> In the next game against the [[Arizona Cardinals]], Kelce had seven receptions for 110 yards for his first NFL game with over 100 receiving yards.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Kansas City Chiefs at Arizona Cardinals – December 7th, 2014 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201412070crd.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180125134504/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201412070crd.htm |archive-date=January 25, 2018 |access-date=January 24, 2018 |publisher=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> In the regular-season finale against the [[San Diego Chargers]], he had an offensive fumble recovery for a touchdown in the 19–7 victory.<ref>{{Cite web |title=San Diego Chargers at Kansas City Chiefs – December 28th, 2014 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201412280kan.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171108032549/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201412280kan.htm |archive-date=November 8, 2017 |access-date=April 1, 2018 |publisher=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref> Kelce was the Chiefs' leading receiver during the 2014 season, totaling 862 yards off 67 receptions.<ref>{{Cite web |title=2014 Kansas City Chiefs Statistics & Players |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/teams/kan/2014.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171115015504/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/teams/kan/2014.htm |archive-date=November 15, 2017 |access-date=January 24, 2018 |publisher=Pro-Football-Reference.com}}</ref>

===2016 season===
{{See also|2016 Kansas City Chiefs season}}
On January 29, 2016, Kelce signed a five-year, $46 million contract extension.<ref>{{Cite web |date=January 29, 2016 |title=Kelce signs rich contract extension with Chiefs |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/story/_/id/14672784/travis-kelce-agrees-contract-extension-kansas-city-chiefs |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160130092657/http://espn.go.com/nfl/story/_/id/14672784/travis-kelce-agrees-contract-extension-kansas-city-chiefs |archive-date=January 30, 2016 |access-date=January 30, 2016 |website=[[ESPN.com]] |agency=[[Associated Press]]}}</ref> He was ranked 91st by his fellow players on the [[NFL Top 100 Players of 2016]].<ref name="auto"/>

During Week 8 against the [[Indianapolis Colts]], Kelce had seven receptions for 101 yards and a touchdown.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Kansas City Chiefs at Indianapolis Colts – October 30th, 2016 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201610300clt.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180125134500/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201610300clt.htm |archive-date=January 25, 2018 |access-date=January 24, 2018 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]]}}</ref> In the next game against the [[Jacksonville Jaguars]], he was ejected after receiving two unsportsmanlike conduct penalties after arguing with two officials over not having a pass interference penalty called.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Shook |first=Nick |date=November 6, 2016 |title=Travis Kelce ejected from Chief's game after tirade |url=https://www.nfl.com/news/travis-kelce-ejected-from-chiefs-game-after-tirade-0ap3000000734522 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161107093040/http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000734522/article/travis-kelce-ejected-from-chiefs-game-after-tirade |archive-date=November 7, 2016 |access-date=November 6, 2016 |website=[[NFL.com]]}}</ref> The second resulted from him sarcastically throwing his towel at field judge Mike Weatherford in a flagging motion due to being upset about the first penalty. He was later fined $24,309 for his outburst.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Bergman |first=Jeremy |date=November 11, 2016 |title=Travis Kelce fined 24K for Unsportsmanlike Conduct |url=https://www.nfl.com/news/travis-kelce-fined-24k-for-unsportsmanlike-conduct-0ap3000000737677 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161112145422/http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000737677/article/travis-kelce-fined-24k-for-unsportsmanlike-conduct |archive-date=November 12, 2016 |access-date=November 11, 2016 |website=[[NFL.com]]}}</ref> During Week 13 against the [[Atlanta Falcons]], he had eight receptions for 140 yards.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Kansas City Chiefs at Atlanta Falcons – December 4th, 2016 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201612040atl.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171210071930/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201612040atl.htm |archive-date=December 10, 2017 |access-date=January 24, 2018 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]]}}</ref> In the next game, Kelce recorded 101 receiving yards against the [[Oakland Raiders]], his fourth consecutive game topping 100.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Oakland Raiders at Kansas City Chiefs – December 8th, 2016 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201612080kan.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180125134506/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201612080kan.htm |archive-date=January 25, 2018 |access-date=January 24, 2018 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]]}}</ref> He joined [[Jimmy Graham]] and former Chiefs tight end [[Tony Gonzalez]] as the only NFL tight ends ever to do so.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Teicher |first=Adam |date=December 9, 2016 |title=Travis Kelce joins Tony Gonzalez in Chiefs' receiving record book |url=https://www.espn.com/blog/nflnation/post/_/id/224056/travis-kelce-joins-tony-gonzalez-in-chiefs-receiving-record-book |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190402074522/http://www.espn.com/blog/nflnation/post/_/id/224056/travis-kelce-joins-tony-gonzalez-in-chiefs-receiving-record-book |archive-date=April 2, 2019 |access-date=December 2, 2020 |website=[[ESPN.com]]}}</ref> In a Christmas Day win over the Broncos, Kelce had career bests of 11 receptions for 160 yards and a career-long 80-yard touchdown on a screen pass.<ref name="glog"/> He finished the season with career highs in yards (1,125) and receptions (85).<ref>{{Cite web |title=Travis Kelce 2016 Game Log |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/K/KelcTr00/gamelog/2016 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180125134440/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/K/KelcTr00/gamelog/2016 |archive-date=January 25, 2018 |access-date=January 24, 2018 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]]}}</ref> His 1,125 receiving yards led the league among tight ends and his 85 receptions were second among tight ends behind [[Dennis Pitta]] of the [[Baltimore Ravens]]. Kelce's 634 yards after the catch also led all NFL tight ends.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Travis Kelce Advanced Stats and Metrics Profile: Yards After The Catch |url=http://www.playerprofiler.com/nfl/travis-kelce |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201111205351/https://www.playerprofiler.com/nfl/travis-kelce/ |archive-date=November 11, 2020 |access-date=December 2, 2020 |website=PlayerProfiler.com}}</ref> He was named as a starter in his second career Pro Bowl, held on December 20, 2016.<ref>{{Cite web |date=December 20, 2016 |title=NFL announces 2017 Pro Bowl rosters |url=https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-announces-2017-pro-bowl-rosters-0ap3000000760503 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181117075658/http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000760503/article/nfl-announces-2017-pro-bowl-rosters |archive-date=November 17, 2018 |access-date=December 2, 2020 |website=[[NFL.com]]}}</ref> He was also named First-team [[All-Pro]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=January 6, 2017 |title=Three rookies, Matt Ryan among players named to All-Pro team |url=https://www.nfl.com/news/three-rookies-matt-ryan-among-players-named-to-all-pro-team-0ap3000000770458 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201221191219/https://www.nfl.com/news/three-rookies-matt-ryan-among-players-named-to-all-pro-team-0ap3000000770458 |archive-date=December 21, 2020 |website=[[NFL.com]] |agency=[[Associated Press]]}}</ref> He was ranked 26th by his fellow players, and second among tight ends, on the [[NFL Top 100 Players of 2017]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=2017 NFL Top 100 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/awards/2017-nfl-top-100.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220511024213/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/awards/2017-nfl-top-100.htm |archive-date=May 11, 2022 |access-date=January 12, 2021 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]] |language=en}}</ref>

The Chiefs finished atop the [[AFC West]] with a 12–4 record and earned a first-round bye in the playoffs.<ref>{{Cite web |title=2016 NFL Standings & Team Stats |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/years/2016 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180329001215/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/years/2016/ |archive-date=March 29, 2018 |access-date=January 31, 2018 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]]}}</ref> In the [[2016–17 NFL playoffs#AFC: Pittsburgh Steelers 18, Kansas City Chiefs 16|Divisional Round]] against the [[Pittsburgh Steelers]], Kelce had five receptions for 77 yards in the 18–16 loss.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Divisional Round – Pittsburgh Steelers at Kansas City Chiefs – January 15th, 2017 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201701150kan.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180106173254/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201701150kan.htm |archive-date=January 6, 2018 |access-date=January 31, 2018 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]]}}</ref>

The 10–6 Chiefs<ref>{{Cite web |title=2017 Kansas City Chiefs Statistics & Players |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/teams/kan/2017.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180126205533/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/teams/kan/2017.htm |archive-date=January 26, 2018 |access-date=January 24, 2018 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]]}}</ref> entered the [[2017–18 NFL playoffs#AFC: Tennessee Titans 22, Kansas City Chiefs 21|Wild Card Round]] of the playoffs against the [[Tennessee Titans]], where Kelce finished with four receptions for 66 yards and a touchdown in the 21–22 defeat.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Wild Card – Tennessee Titans at Kansas City Chiefs – January 6th, 2018 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201801060kan.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180110052938/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201801060kan.htm |archive-date=January 10, 2018 |access-date=January 24, 2018 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]]}}</ref> He was not able to finish the game as he suffered a concussion in the first half on a hit to his helmet.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Rapaport |first=Daniel |date=January 6, 2018 |title=Chiefs TE Travis Kelce suffered concussion vs. Titans |url=https://www.si.com/nfl/2018/01/06/travis-kelce-chiefs-titans-locker-room-head-injury-concussion |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180402101520/https://www.si.com/nfl/2018/01/06/travis-kelce-chiefs-titans-locker-room-head-injury-concussion |archive-date=April 2, 2018 |access-date=April 1, 2018 |magazine=Sports Illustrated}}</ref>

===2018 season===
{{See also|2018 Kansas City Chiefs season}}
In the 2018 season, Kelce benefited from the rise of new quarterback [[Patrick Mahomes]], who was named [[NFL MVP]] at the end of the season.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Benoit |first=Andy |date=August 24, 2018 |title=Chiefs preview: Andy Reid ready to let Mahomes loose? |url=https://www.si.com/nfl/2018/08/24/kansas-city-chiefs-2018-nfl-team-preview |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181005194950/https://www.si.com/nfl/2018/08/24/kansas-city-chiefs-2018-nfl-team-preview |archive-date=October 5, 2018 |access-date=October 5, 2018 |magazine=Sports Illustrated}}</ref> After being held to a lone reception for six yards in the season opener against the Chargers, he rebounded with seven receptions for 106 yards and two touchdowns in a Week 2 road victory over the Steelers.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Dulle |first=Brian |date=September 16, 2018 |title=Mahomes throws 6 TDs, Chiefs hold off Steelers 42–37 |work=FOX 4 Kansas City WDAF-TV |url=https://fox4kc.com/2018/09/16/chiefs-defeat-steelers-42-37-now-2-0-for-the-season/ |url-status=live |access-date=October 5, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181005194723/https://fox4kc.com/2018/09/16/chiefs-defeat-steelers-42-37-now-2-0-for-the-season/ |archive-date=October 5, 2018}}</ref> In two of the next three games, he was able to reach 100 receiving yards against the [[San Francisco 49ers]] and the Jaguars.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Rimpson |first=Robert |date=September 23, 2018 |title=Chiefs' players of the game Week 3 vs. 49ers |work=USA Today |url=https://chiefswire.usatoday.com/2018/09/23/chiefs-players-of-the-game-week-3-vs-49ers/ |url-status=live |access-date=November 1, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181231194158/https://chiefswire.usatoday.com/2018/09/23/chiefs-players-of-the-game-week-3-vs-49ers/ |archive-date=December 31, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=October 7, 2018 |title=Chiefs' Travis Kelce: Tallies 100 yards |url=https://www.cbssports.com/fantasy/football/news/chiefs-travis-kelce-tallies-100-yards/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190101041422/https://www.cbssports.com/fantasy/football/news/chiefs-travis-kelce-tallies-100-yards/ |archive-date=January 1, 2019 |access-date=November 1, 2018 |website=CBSSports.com}}</ref> He added 99 yards and two touchdowns in a Week 9 win over the [[Cleveland Browns]], and went into the Week 12 bye with 10 receptions for 127 yards and a touchdown in [[2018 Kansas City Chiefs–Los Angeles Rams game|an offensively spectacular 54–51 loss]] to the [[Los Angeles Rams]]. In the Week 13 win over the Raiders, Kelce had career-bests of 12 receptions and 168 yards, including two short touchdowns in the first half.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Kansas City Chiefs at Oakland Raiders – December 2nd, 2018 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201812020rai.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181211010403/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201812020rai.htm |archive-date=December 11, 2018 |access-date=January 6, 2019 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]]}}</ref> At this point, he was well on his way to an NFL record, but his production tapered off; over the final four weeks, Kelce averaged six receptions for 63.5 yards and had only one touchdown reception.<ref name="glog"/> In Week 17, Kelce indeed broke the NFL record for most receiving yards by a tight end in a single season, but 49ers tight end [[George Kittle]] passed him to claim the record less than an hour later.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Weinrib |first=Ben |date=December 31, 2018 |title=Travis Kelce broke the TE yardage record and lost it to George Kittle in less than an hour |url=https://www.yahoo.com/amphtml/sports/travis-kelce-broke-te-yardage-record-lost-george-kittle-less-hour-022504480.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102130722/https://www.yahoo.com/amphtml/sports/travis-kelce-broke-te-yardage-record-lost-george-kittle-less-hour-022504480.html |archive-date=January 2, 2019 |access-date=October 22, 2020 |website=Yahoo Sports}}</ref> Kelce ended the regular season at 10th in the NFL in receptions with 103 and receiving yards with 1,336, and sixth in receiving touchdowns with 10.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Travis Kelce 2018 Game Log |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/K/KelcTr00.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190223042817/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/K/KelcTr00.htm |archive-date=February 23, 2019 |access-date=February 22, 2019 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]]}}</ref> He was named to the [[2018 Pro Bowl]] and was named first-team All-Pro.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Teope |first=Herbie |date=January 4, 2019 |title=All-Pro Team: Donald, Mahomes among highlights |url=https://www.nfl.com/news/all-pro-team-donald-mahomes-among-highlights-0ap3000001007645 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190807044014/http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000001007645/article/allpro-team-patrick-mahomes-among-2018-highlights |archive-date=August 7, 2019 |access-date=October 22, 2020 |website=[[NFL.com]]}}</ref>

The Chiefs finished atop the AFC West with a 12–4 record and earned a first-round bye.<ref>{{Cite web |title=2018 NFL Standings & Team Stats |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/years/2018/index.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190320205744/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/years/2018/index.htm |archive-date=March 20, 2019 |access-date=February 22, 2019 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]]}}</ref> In the [[2018–19 NFL playoffs#AFC: Kansas City Chiefs 31, Indianapolis Colts 13|Divisional Round]] against the Colts, he had seven receptions for 108 yards in the 31–13 victory.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Divisional Round – Indianapolis Colts at Kansas City Chiefs – January 12th, 2019 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201901120kan.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190122044116/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201901120kan.htm |archive-date=January 22, 2019 |access-date=February 22, 2019 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]]}}</ref> In the [[2018–19 NFL playoffs#AFC: New England Patriots 37, Kansas City Chiefs 31 (OT)|AFC Championship]] against the Patriots, he had three receptions for 23 yards and a receiving touchdown in the 37–31 overtime loss.<ref>{{Cite web |title=AFC Championship – New England Patriots at Kansas City Chiefs – January 20th, 2019 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201901200kan.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190209124408/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201901200kan.htm |archive-date=February 9, 2019 |access-date=February 22, 2019 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]]}}</ref> He was ranked 21st by his fellow players on the [[NFL Top 100 Players of 2018]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=2019 NFL Top 100 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/awards/2019-nfl-top-100.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220511024217/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/awards/2019-nfl-top-100.htm |archive-date=May 11, 2022 |access-date=September 2, 2022 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]] |language=en}}</ref>

===2019 season: First Super Bowl win===
{{See also|2019 Kansas City Chiefs season}}
During Week 2 against the Raiders, Kelce caught seven passes for 107 yards and a touchdown of the season as the Chiefs won by a score of 28–10.<ref>{{Cite web |date=September 15, 2019 |title=Mahomes' 4 TDs in 2nd quarter lead Chiefs past Raiders 28–10 |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401128118 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200118172408/https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401128118 |archive-date=January 18, 2020 |access-date=September 15, 2019 |website=[[ESPN.com]] |agency=[[Associated Press]]}}</ref> Despite injuries to Patrick Mahomes and just two touchdowns, at the midpoint of the season Kelce led all tight ends and Chiefs players in receiving yards with 604.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Tight ends with at least 500 receiving yards through eight games, NFL history |url=http://pfref.com/tiny/2rkLx |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191107200549/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/play-index/tiny.fcgi?id=2rkLx |archive-date=November 7, 2019 |access-date=May 27, 2020 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Chiefs receiving through eight games, 2012–2019 seasons |url=http://pfref.com/tiny/YGdTT |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191107200546/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/play-index/tiny.fcgi?id=YGdTT |archive-date=November 7, 2019 |access-date=May 27, 2020 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]]}}</ref> During Week 11 against the Chargers on ''[[Monday Night Football]]'' in Mexico, Kelce caught seven passes for 92 yards and a touchdown in the 24–17 win.<ref>{{Cite web |date=November 18, 2019 |title=Mahomes, Chiefs hold off Chargers 24–17 in Mexico City |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401128134 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200709100906/https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401128134 |archive-date=July 9, 2020 |access-date=November 18, 2019 |website=[[ESPN.com]] |agency=[[Associated Press]]}}</ref> During Week 14 against the Patriots, Kelce caught seven passes for 66 yards and rushed the ball once for a one-yard touchdown during the 23–16 road victory.<ref>{{Cite web |date=December 8, 2019 |title=KC survives mistakes, take AFC West with 23–13 win over Pats |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401127930 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191210192344/https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401127930 |archive-date=December 10, 2019 |access-date=December 8, 2019 |website=[[ESPN.com]] |agency=[[Associated Press]]}}</ref> In the next game against the Broncos, Kelce finished with 11 catches for 142 receiving yards as the Chiefs won 23–3.<ref>{{Cite web |date=December 15, 2019 |title=Chiefs roll to 23–3 victory over Broncos at snowy Arrowhead |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401128056 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191217230828/https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401128056 |archive-date=December 17, 2019 |access-date=December 15, 2019 |website=[[ESPN.com]] |agency=[[Associated Press]]}}</ref> In the next game against the [[Chicago Bears]] on ''[[NBC Sunday Night Football|Sunday Night Football]]'', he caught eight passes for 74 yards and a touchdown in the 26–3 win. During the game, he became the fastest tight end in NFL history to record 500 career receptions.<ref>{{Cite web |date=December 22, 2019 |title=Mahomes throws 2 TDs, runs for 1 as Chiefs beat Bears 26–3 |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401127943 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191223231647/https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401127943 |archive-date=December 23, 2019 |access-date=December 22, 2019 |website=[[ESPN.com]] |agency=[[Associated Press]]}}</ref>

Kelce finished the 2019 season with 97 receptions for 1,229 receiving yards and five receiving touchdowns to go along with his one rushing touchdown.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Travis Kelce 2019 Game Log |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/K/KelcTr00/gamelog/2019/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200606032640/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/K/KelcTr00/gamelog/2019/ |archive-date=June 6, 2020 |access-date=January 30, 2020 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]]}}</ref> Kelce became the first tight end in NFL history to record four consecutive seasons with at least 1,000 receiving yards.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Conner |first=Matt |date=December 15, 2019 |title=Travis Kelce becomes first tight end with 4 consecutive 1,000-yard seasons |url=https://arrowheadaddict.com/2019/12/15/travis-kelce-becomes-first-tight-end-4-consecutive-1000-yard-seasons/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220118182426/https://arrowheadaddict.com/2019/12/15/travis-kelce-becomes-first-tight-end-4-consecutive-1000-yard-seasons/ |archive-date=January 18, 2022 |access-date=January 30, 2020 |website=Arrowhead Addict}}</ref> He was named to his fifth Pro Bowl for his 2019 season.<ref>{{Cite web |title=2019 NFL Pro Bowlers |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/years/2019/probowl.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220627030242/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/years/2019/probowl.htm |archive-date=June 27, 2022 |access-date=September 2, 2022 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]] |language=en}}</ref>

In the [[2019–20 NFL playoffs#AFC: Kansas City Chiefs 51, Houston Texans 31|Divisional Round]] against the Texans, the Chiefs began the game with a 24–0 deficit. The Chiefs then went on a 51–7 run, including 41 unanswered points, to win 51–31. After a drop on third down on the Chiefs first drive that would have been a first down if it had been caught, Kelce caught 10 passes for 134 yards and three touchdowns (all in the second quarter) as he helped lead the Chiefs to their second consecutive conference championship game.<ref>{{Cite web |date=January 12, 2020 |title=Chiefs rally from 24–0 hole to beat Texans 51–31 in playoffs |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401131043 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200306163825/https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401131043 |archive-date=March 6, 2020 |access-date=January 12, 2020 |website=[[ESPN.com]] |agency=[[Associated Press]]}}</ref> In the [[2019–20 NFL playoffs#AFC Championship Game: Kansas City Chiefs 35, Tennessee Titans 24|AFC Championship Game]] against the Titans, Kelce caught three passes for 30 yards during the 35–24 win.<ref>{{Cite web |date=January 19, 2020 |title=Mahomes' feet, arms, lift Chiefs to Super Bowl over Titans |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401131044 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201222135813/https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401131044 |archive-date=December 22, 2020 |access-date=January 19, 2020 |website=[[ESPN.com]] |agency=[[Associated Press]]}}</ref> In [[Super Bowl LIV]] against the [[San Francisco 49ers]], Kelce caught six passes for 43 receiving yards and a receiving touchdown and had one carry for two rushing yards during the 31–20 win.<ref>{{Cite web |date=February 2, 2020 |title=Mahomes leads Chiefs' rally past 49ers in Super Bowl, 31–20 |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401131047 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210308041457/https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401131047 |archive-date=March 8, 2021 |access-date=February 2, 2020 |website=[[ESPN.com]] |agency=[[Associated Press]]}}</ref> He was ranked 18th by his fellow players on the [[NFL Top 100 Players of 2020]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=2020 NFL Top 100 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/awards/2020-nfl-top-100.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220408124719/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/awards/2020-nfl-top-100.htm |archive-date=April 8, 2022 |access-date=September 2, 2022 |website=[[Pro ===2020 season===
{{See also|2020 Kansas City Chiefs season}}
Following the release of long-time Chiefs punter [[Dustin Colquitt]] in the offseason, Kelce became tied with [[Anthony Sherman]] and fellow 2013 draftee [[Eric Fisher (American football)|Eric Fisher]] as the team's longest tenured members.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |last=Conner |first=Matt |date=May 13, 2020 |title=Travis Kelce's growth as a leader now faces new challenge |url=https://arrowheadaddict.com/2020/05/13/travis-kelces-growth-leader-longest-tenured-chiefs/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200820124715/https://arrowheadaddict.com/2020/05/13/travis-kelces-growth-leader-longest-tenured-chiefs/ |archive-date=August 20, 2020 |access-date=September 17, 2020 |website=Arrowhead Addict |language=en-US}}</ref> On August 14, 2020, Kelce signed a four-year, $57 million contract extension with the Chiefs through the 2025 season.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Patra |first=Kevin |date=August 13, 2020 |title=Chiefs, TE Travis Kelce agree to terms on four-year, $57M extension |url=https://www.nfl.com/news/chiefs-travis-kelce-contract-extension |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200916104316/https://www.nfl.com/news/chiefs-travis-kelce-contract-extension |archive-date=September 16, 2020 |access-date=September 17, 2020 |website=[[NFL.com]]}}</ref> In Week 6, he caught two touchdowns in a 26–17 victory over the [[Buffalo Bills]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Kansas City Chiefs at Buffalo Bills – October 19th, 2020 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202010190buf.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201020053723/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202010190buf.htm |archive-date=October 20, 2020 |access-date=October 22, 2020 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]] |language=en}}</ref> In Week 8 against the Jets, Kelce dunked the ball through the goal posts after scoring a touchdown, paying homage to former Chiefs tight end [[Tony Gonzalez]]. He was penalized for unsportsmanlike conduct and was fined $12,500.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Teope |first=Herbie |date=November 7, 2020 |title=NFL dings Chiefs' Kelce $12,500 for unsportsmanlike conduct after his dunk on the Jets |url=https://www.kansascity.com/sports/nfl/kansas-city-chiefs/article247041557.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201111202203/https://www.kansascity.com/sports/nfl/kansas-city-chiefs/article247041557.html |archive-date=November 11, 2020 |access-date=November 13, 2020 |website=KansasCity.com}}</ref> In Week 9, against the [[Carolina Panthers]], he had ten receptions for 159 receiving yards in the 33–31 victory.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Carolina Panthers at Kansas City Chiefs – November 8th, 2020 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202011080kan.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201115121822/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202011080kan.htm |archive-date=November 15, 2020 |access-date=November 13, 2020 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]] |language=en}}</ref>

In Week 11 against the [[Las Vegas Raiders]] on ''Sunday Night Football'', Kelce recorded eight catches for 127 yards and scored the game-winning touchdown in a 35–31 win.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Kansas City Chiefs at Las Vegas Raiders – November 22nd, 2020 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202011220rai.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201202085734/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202011220rai.htm |archive-date=December 2, 2020 |access-date=November 28, 2020 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]] |language=en}}</ref>
In Week 13 against the Broncos on ''Sunday Night Football'', he caught eight passes for 136 yards and a touchdown during the 22–16 win.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Denver Broncos at Kansas City Chiefs – December 6th, 2020 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202012060kan.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201127103220/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202012060kan.htm |archive-date=November 27, 2020 |access-date=December 8, 2020 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]] |language=en}}</ref> In the following game against the Dolphins, he again posted eight catches for 136 yards and a touchdown in a 33–27 victory.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Kansas City Chiefs at Miami Dolphins – December 13th, 2020 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202012130mia.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201127111907/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202012130mia.htm |archive-date=November 27, 2020 |access-date=December 18, 2020 |website=[[Pro Football Reference]] |language=en}}</ref> In Week 16, Kelce became the first tight end with two 100-catch seasons.<ref name="Receptions"/><ref name="Reception record"/> Kelce caught seven passes, giving him a career-high 105 for the season. Kelce set the single-season yardage record for a tight end with 1,416, topping [[George Kittle]]'s 1,377 in 2018.<ref name="Receptions"/><ref name="Reception record"/><ref>{{Cite web |last=Teicher |first=Adam |date=December 27, 2020 |title=Kansas City Chiefs clinch No. 1 seed in AFC as Travis Kelce sets records |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/story/_/id/30607014/kansas-city-chiefs-clinch-no-1-seed-afc-travis-kelce-sets-records |url-status=live |access-date=December 28, 2020 |website=ESPN |language=en}}</ref> His yardage ranked second overall in the 2020 NFL season (behind [[Stefon Diggs]]' 1,535), while his total receptions ranked fifth in the NFL and second among tight ends (behind [[Darren Waller]]'s 107).<ref>{{Cite web |title=2020 Player Stats – Receiving |url=https://www.nfl.com/stats/player-stats/category/receiving/2020/REG/all/receivingreceptions/DESC |url-status=live |access-date=January 5, 2021 |website=[[NFL.com]] |language=en}}</ref> He was named to his sixth Pro Bowl and earned First-team All-Pro honors.<ref>{{Cite web |title=2020 NFL Pro Bowlers |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/years/2020/probowl.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220627025942/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/years/2020/probowl.htm |archive-date=June 27, 2022 |access-date=September 2, 2022 |website=[[Pro Football In the [[2020–21 NFL playoffs#AFC: Kansas City Chiefs 22, Cleveland Browns 17|Divisional Round of the playoffs]] against the Browns, Kelce caught eight passes for 109 yards and a touchdown during the 22–17 win.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Divisional Round – Cleveland Browns at Kansas City Chiefs – January 17th, 2021 |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202101170kan.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210116103431/https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202101170kan.htm |archive-date=January 16, 2021 |access-date=January 20, 2021 |website=[[Pro
